author: bridge-bot
content:

https://lab.ethpandaops.io/ethereum/execution/payloads?page=0&blockNumber=24048617&referenceNodes=true, everybody sucked on it

author: bridge-bot
content:
<fede_intern> re: **@parithoshj**
> From Matty:
individual payload observations are now exposed on The Lab](https://lab.ethpandaops.io/ethereum/execution/payloads. Direct linking to the corresponding blocks. Reach out if you've got questions or want help digging into the data.

There's a filter for reference nodes, so we can use this as a way to figure out which exact blocks are bad on reference machines on mainnet and then convert those into new benchmarks and eventually stateful tests.
this is great. we will try to see whats needed ti integrate ethrex asap

author: bridge-bot

author: bridge-bot
content:
<gakonst> We have been using Pyroscope in our Grafana instance. It seems like there's a lot of potential to get really deep w spans and traces to deeply understand bottlenecks, FYI in case anyone finds it interesting: https://github.com/grafana/pyroscope

Also Dani put together a perf <> tracing bridge for samply, for annotating flamegraphs, also FYI for ppl making things fast over the break üôå https://github.com/DaniPopes/tracing-samply

author: bridge-bot
content:
<gakonst> re: **@gakonst**
> We have been using Pyroscope in our Grafana instance. It seems like there's a lot of potential to get really deep w spans and traces to deeply understand bottlenecks, FYI in case anyone finds it interesting: https://github.com/grafana/pyroscope

Also Dani put together a perf <> tracing bridge for samply, for annotating flamegraphs, also FYI for ppl making things fast over the break üôå https://github.com/DaniPopes/tracing-samply
I still feel we need a good tool for generating "worse case bytecode sequences" automated - which maximize the bytecode sequence for "cpu time over gas" https://arxiv.org/abs/1909.07220
